• **Autokinesis**-Apparent movement. After staring at a point of light for a few moments, the light appears to move on its own
  • **False Horizon**-Illusion caused by the real horizon not being obvious and other areas of light or dark cause the perception of the wrong horizon.
  • **Reversible Perspective Illusion**-The perception that an object is moving away from the pilot when it is actually moving toward the pilot (or *vice versa*); often, when another airplane is flying parallel to the pilot's course
  • **Size-Distance Illusion**- An illusion caused by an object's varying brightness. A pilot may mistakenly interpret increasing brightness as closing movement.
  • **Fascination (Fixation)**-A tendency to become fixated on a particular object or area, inside or outside of the airplane, causing the pilot to lose perspective of the bigger picture
  • **Flicker Vertigo**-Lights flickering at a rate of 4-20 cycles per second can produce unpleasant and possibly dangerous reactions like nausea, vomiting or vertigo. Maintaining a constant scan can help prevent this reaction
    • (Pilot's Handbook of Aeronautical Knowledge 17-26)
